summary: This is an email from December 9, 2018, summarizing findings from FBI 302 reports related to Jeffrey Epstein's activities in New York. It compiles references to victims describing calls from Epstein in New York to schedule 'work' involving sexual activity.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to indirectly as the person who would call victims 'from New York' to schedule appointments for 'work' that involved sexual activity.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a victim statement where Epstein would call from New York to schedule work.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is involved in documenting victim statements about Epstein's calls from New York to schedule sexual activity.

events.title: Victim Descriptions of Epstein's Calls from New York
events.description: Multiple victims describe receiving calls from Jeffrey Epstein in New York to schedule 'work' appointments that involved sexual activity, including intercourse and massages with sexual contact.

keyFacts: Multiple victims in FBI 302 reports state Jeffrey Epstein would call them 'from New York' to schedule appointments for 'work'.
The 'work' described by victims included sexual activity, with specific mentions of penetration/intercourse when one victim was 17 years old.
Some victims provided massages to Epstein in NYC and knew friends who did the same, with reports of little to no sexual contact in some instances.
The email references leads on possible additional victims in New York.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York is noted in connection with one victim's statement.
